content: Good evening, I am new to working with Lean but excited to where formalization is headed, and have already tried out some of the tutorials!

I have a question: Recently I created a new project (as described on the Leanprover Community GIthub), and mostly it seemed to work but VSCode spits out a weird error whenever I try to import one of my own lean files. On "import MyProject.Definitions" I get the message

unknown package 'MyProject'
You might need to open '[the folder that I've opened in VSCode]' as a workspace in your editor

anyone have a clue what I should do?
I tried a bit of googling but it seems that no one else had this problem...

Did you use VS Code's "open folder" functionality to open the root directory of your project? Does import Mathlib.Tactic work? Are you putting your files in MyProject? Can you send a screenshot with your lakefile.lean open and the VS Code file explorer open?

Kevin Buzzard said:

Did you use VS Code's "open folder" functionality to open the root directory of your project? Does import Mathlib.Tactic work? Are you putting your files in MyProject? Can you send a screenshot with your lakefile.lean open and the VS Code file explorer open?

Thanks for the reply! In fact I can answer yes to all of your questions. Here is a screenshot:
Screenshot-from-2024-02-16-01-23-20.png

Well Lean is correct that it can't find a package called MyProject, the only package you've initialised, according to the lakefile, is one called Shenanigans. Either change all Shenanigans to MyProjects or change all MyProjects to Shenanigans (be careful with capital/small letters) and you should be OK.
I ran across this archived chat where someone apparently had the opposite issue: that imports worked in VSCode but not in console.
That did help. Sorry for the stupid question and thanks again.
Paul Schwahn has marked this topic as resolved.
The #new members stream is precisely for this sort of question, you don't have to be sorry. Thanks for posting it in the right place.
